00066 /***************************************************************************\
00067  *
00068  * BreakPt(AvrClass) Methods
00069  *
00070 \***************************************************************************/
00071 
00072 #ifndef DOXYGEN                 /* don't expose to doxygen */
00073 
00074 typedef struct _BreakPt BreakPt;
00075 struct _BreakPt
00076 {
00077     AvrClass parent;
00078     int pc;
00079     uint16_t opcode;
00080 };
00081 
00082 #endif
00083 
00084 static BreakPt *brk_pt_new (int pc, uint16_t opcode);
00085 static void brk_pt_construct (BreakPt *bp, int pc, uint16_t opcode);
00086 static void brk_pt_destroy (void *bp);
00087 
00088 static BreakPt *
00089 brk_pt_new (int pc, uint16_t opcode)
00090 {
00091     BreakPt *bp;
00092 
00093     bp = avr_new (BreakPt, 1);
00094     brk_pt_construct (bp, pc, opcode);
00095     class_overload_destroy ((AvrClass *)bp, brk_pt_destroy);
00096 
00097     return bp;
00098 }
00099 
00100 static void
00101 brk_pt_construct (BreakPt *bp, int pc, uint16_t opcode)
00102 {
00103     if (bp == NULL)
00104         avr_error ("passed null ptr");
00105 
00106     class_construct ((AvrClass *)bp);
00107 
00108     bp->pc = pc;
00109     bp->opcode = opcode;
00110 }
00111 
00112 static void
00113 brk_pt_destroy (void *bp)
00114 {
00115     BreakPt *_bp = (BreakPt *)bp;
00116 
00117     if (_bp == NULL)
00118         return;
00119 
00120     class_destroy (bp);
00121 }
00122 
00123 static DList *brk_pt_list_add (DList *head, int pc, uint16_t opcode);
00124 static DList *brk_pt_list_delete (DList *head, int pc);
00125 static BreakPt *brk_pt_list_lookup (DList *head, int pc);
00126 static int brk_pt_cmp (AvrClass *d1, AvrClass *d2);
00127 
00128 /* Compare function for break points. */
00129 
00130 static int
00131 brk_pt_cmp (AvrClass *d1, AvrClass *d2)
00132 {
00133     return ((BreakPt *)d1)->pc - ((BreakPt *)d2)->pc;
00134 }
00135 
00136 static DList *
00137 brk_pt_list_add (DList *head, int pc, uint16_t opcode)
00138 {
00139     BreakPt *bp = brk_pt_new (pc, opcode);
00140 
00141     return dlist_add (head, (AvrClass *)bp, brk_pt_cmp);
00142 }
00143 
00144 static DList *
00145 brk_pt_list_delete (DList *head, int pc)
00146 {
00147     BreakPt *bp = brk_pt_new (pc, 0);
00148 
00149     head = dlist_delete (head, (AvrClass *)bp, brk_pt_cmp);
00150     class_unref ((AvrClass *)bp);
00151 
00152     return head;
00153 }
00154 
00155 static BreakPt *
00156 brk_pt_list_lookup (DList *head, int pc)
00157 {
00158     BreakPt *found;
00159     BreakPt *bp = brk_pt_new (pc, 0);
00160 
00161     found = (BreakPt *)dlist_lookup (head, (AvrClass *)bp, brk_pt_cmp);
00162     class_unref ((AvrClass *)bp);
00163 
00164     return found;
00165 }
00166 
00167 static DList *
00168 brk_pt_iterator (DList *head, DListFP_Iter func, void *user_data)
00169 {
00170     return dlist_iterator (head, func, user_data);
00171 }

00173 /***************************************************************************\
00174  *
00175  * Irq(AvrClass) Methods: For managing the irq_pending list.
00176  *
00177 \***************************************************************************/
00178 
00179 #ifndef DOXYGEN                 /* don't expose to doxygen */
00180 
00181 typedef struct _Irq Irq;
00182 struct _Irq
00183 {
00184     AvrClass parent;
00185     IntVect *vector;
00186 
00187     /* These are only used for storing lookup information. Copies of
00188        core->{state,sleep_mode}. */
00189     int state;
00190     unsigned int sleep_mode;
00191 };
00192 
00193 #endif
00194 
00195 static Irq *irq_new (IntVect *vector, int state,
00196                             unsigned int sleep_mode);
00197 static void irq_construct (Irq *irq, IntVect *vector, int state,
00198                                   unsigned int sleep_mode);
00199 static void irq_destroy (void *irq);
00200 
00201 static Irq *
00202 irq_new (IntVect *vector, int state, unsigned int sleep_mode)
00203 {
00204     Irq *irq;
00205 
00206     irq = avr_new (Irq, 1);
00207     irq_construct (irq, vector, state, sleep_mode);
00208     class_overload_destroy ((AvrClass *)irq, irq_destroy);
00209 
00210     return irq;
00211 }
00212 
00213 static void
00214 irq_construct (Irq *irq, IntVect *vector, int state, unsigned int sleep_mode)
00215 {
00216     if (irq == NULL)
00217         avr_error ("passed null ptr");
00218 
00219     class_construct ((AvrClass *)irq);
00220 
00221     irq->vector = vector;
00222     irq->state = state;
00223     irq->sleep_mode = sleep_mode;
00224 }
00225 
00226 static void
00227 irq_destroy (void *irq)
00228 {
00229     Irq *_irq = (Irq *)irq;
00230 
00231     if (_irq == NULL)
00232         return;
00233 
00234     class_destroy (irq);
00235 }
00236 
00237 static DList *irq_list_add (DList *head, IntVect *vector);
00238 static DList *irq_list_delete (DList *head, IntVect *vector);
00239 #if 0                           /* TRoth/2002-09-15: This isn't used. ??? */
00240 static Irq *irq_list_lookup_addr (DList *head, IntVect *vector);
00241 #endif
00242 static int irq_cmp_addr (AvrClass *d1, AvrClass *d2);
00243 static int irq_cmp_pending (AvrClass *d1, AvrClass *d2);
00244 
00245 /* Compare function for break points. */
00246 
00247 static int
00248 irq_cmp_addr (AvrClass *d1, AvrClass *d2)
00249 {
00250     return ((Irq *)d1)->vector->addr - ((Irq *)d2)->vector->addr;
00251 }
00252 
00253 static DList *
00254 irq_list_add (DList *head, IntVect *vector)
00255 {
00256     Irq *irq = irq_new (vector, 0, 0);
00257 
00258     return dlist_add (head, (AvrClass *)irq, irq_cmp_addr);
00259 }
00260 
00261 static DList *
00262 irq_list_delete (DList *head, IntVect *vector)
00263 {
00264     Irq *irq = irq_new (vector, 0, 0);
00265 
00266     head = dlist_delete (head, (AvrClass *)irq, irq_cmp_addr);
00267     class_unref ((AvrClass *)irq);
00268 
00269     return head;
00270 }
00271 
00272 #if 0                           /* TRoth/2002-09-15: This isn't used. ??? */
00273 static Irq *
00274 irq_list_lookup_addr (DList *head, IntVect *vector)
00275 {
00276     Irq *found;
00277     Irq *irq = irq_new (vector, 0, 0);
00278 
00279     found = (Irq *)dlist_lookup (head, (AvrClass *)irq, irq_cmp_addr);
00280     class_unref ((AvrClass *)irq);
00281 
00282     return found;
00283 }
00284 #endif
00285 
00286 static int
00287 irq_cmp_pending (AvrClass *d1, AvrClass *d2)
00288 {
00289     Irq *i1 = (Irq *)d1;        /* This is the irq which might be ready to be
00290                                    vectored into. */
00291     int state = ((Irq *)d2)->state; /* The state the device is currently
00292                                        in. */
00293     unsigned int sleep_mode = ((Irq *)d2)->sleep_mode; /* This is the sleep
00294                                                           mode the device in
00295                                                           currently in. Only
00296                                                           one bit should be
00297                                                           set. */
00298 
00299     if (state == STATE_SLEEP)
00300     {
00301         /* If device is in the sleep state, the irq will only pending if it
00302            can wake up the device. */
00303 
00304         if (sleep_mode & i1->vector->can_wake)
00305             return 0;           /* vector into the irq */
00306         else
00307             return -1;          /* try the next irq */
00308     }
00309 
00310     /* If the state is not STATE_SLEEP, any irq we see is automatically
00311        pending, so vector it. */
00312 
00313     return 0;
00314 }
00315 
00316 /* Walk the list looking for a pending irq which can be handled. If the device
00317    is in a sleep state, the can_wake mask could force the head of the list to
00318    not be the irq which gets vectored. */
00319 
00320 static IntVect *
00321 irq_get_pending_vector (DList *head, int state, unsigned int sleep_mode)
00322 {
00323     Irq *found;
00324     Irq *irq = irq_new (NULL, state, sleep_mode);
00325 
00326     found = (Irq *)dlist_lookup (head, (AvrClass *)irq, irq_cmp_pending);
00327     class_unref ((AvrClass *)irq);
00328 
00329     return found->vector;
00330 }
00331 
00332 #if 0                           /* TRoth/2002-09-15: This isn't used. ??? */
00333 static IntVect *
00334 irq_get_head_vector (DList *head)
00335 {
00336     return ((Irq *)dlist_get_head_data (head))->vector;
00337 }
00338 #endif

00340 /***************************************************************************\
00341  *
00342  * AvrCore(AvrClass) Methods

00345 
00346 static void avr_core_construct (AvrCore *core, DevSuppDefn *dev);
00347 
00348 /** \name AvrCore handling methods */
00349 
00350 /*@{*/
00351 
00352 /** \brief Allocate a new AvrCore object. */
00353 
00354 AvrCore *
00355 avr_core_new (char *dev_name)
00356 {
00357     AvrCore *core = NULL;
00358     DevSuppDefn *dev = dev_supp_lookup_device (dev_name);
00359 
00360     if (dev)
00361     {
00362         fprintf (stderr, "\nSimulating a %s device.\n\n", dev_name);
00363 
00364         core = avr_new (AvrCore, 1);
00365         avr_core_construct (core, dev);
00366         class_overload_destroy ((AvrClass *)core, avr_core_destroy);
00367     }
00368 
00369     return core;
00370 }
00371 
00372 /** \brief Constructor for the AvrCore class. */
00373 
00374 static void
00375 avr_core_construct (AvrCore *core, DevSuppDefn *dev)
00376 {
00377     int flash_sz = dev_supp_get_flash_sz (dev);
00378     int PC_sz = dev_supp_get_PC_sz (dev);
00379     int stack_sz = dev_supp_get_stack_sz (dev);
00380     int sram_sz = dev_supp_get_sram_sz (dev);
00381     int xram_sz = dev_supp_get_xram_sz (dev);
00382     int vtab_idx = dev_supp_get_vtab_idx (dev);
00383     int xram_end, sram_end;
00384     int addr;
00385 
00386     if (core == NULL)
00387         avr_error ("passed null ptr");
00388 
00389     class_construct ((AvrClass *)core);
00390 
00391     core->state = STATE_STOPPED;
00392     core->sleep_mode = 0;       /* each bit represents a sleep mode */
00393     core->PC = 0;
00394     core->PC_size = PC_sz;
00395     core->PC_max = flash_sz / 2; /* flash_sz is in bytes, need number of
00396                                     words here */
00397 
00398     core->flash = flash_new (flash_sz);
00399 
00400     core->breakpoints = NULL;
00401 
00402     core->irq_pending = NULL;
00403     core->irq_vtable = (IntVect *)(global_vtable_list[vtab_idx]);
00404     core->irq_offset = 0;
00405 
00406     core->CK = 0;
00407     core->inst_CKS = 0;
00408 
00409     core->clk_cb = NULL;
00410     core->async_cb = NULL;
00411 
00412     /* FIXME: hack to get it to compile. */
00413     if (dev_supp_has_ext_io_reg (dev))
00414         sram_end = 0xff + sram_sz;
00415     else
00416         sram_end = 0x5f + sram_sz;
00417     if (xram_sz)
00418         xram_end = 0xffff;
00419     else
00420         xram_end = sram_end;    /* i.e., no XRAM at all */
00421     if (dev_supp_has_ext_io_reg (dev))
00422         core->mem = mem_new (0x1f, 0xff, sram_end, xram_end);
00423     else
00424         core->mem = mem_new (0x1f, 0x5f, sram_end, xram_end);
00425 
00426     /* Attach the gpwr's to the memory bus. */
00427 
00428     core->gpwr = gpwr_new ();
00429     for (addr = 0; addr < 0x20; addr++)
00430     {
00431         static char *reg_name[] = { "r00", "r01", "r02", "r03", "r04", "r05",
00432                                     "r06", "r07", "r08", "r09", "r10", "r11",
00433                                     "r12", "r13", "r14", "r15", "r16", "r17",
00434                                     "r18", "r19", "r20", "r21", "r22", "r23",
00435                                     "r24", "r25", "r26", "r27", "r28", "r29",
00436                                     "r30", "r31" };
00437 
00438         avr_core_attach_vdev (core, addr, reg_name[addr],
00439                               (VDevice *)core->gpwr, 0, 0, 0xff, 0xff);
00440     }
00441 
00442     dev_supp_attach_io_regs (core, dev);
00443 
00444     /* Set up the stack. */
00445 
00446     if (stack_sz)
00447     {
00448         core->stack = (Stack *)hwstack_new (stack_sz);
00449     }
00450     else
00451     {
00452         /* Assuming that SPL is always at 0x5d. */
00453 
00454         core->stack = (Stack *)memstack_new (core->mem, 0x5d);
00455     }
00456 
00457     /* Assuming the SREG is always at 0x5f. */
00458 
00459     core->sreg = (SREG *)avr_core_get_vdev_by_addr (core, 0x5f);
00460     class_ref ((AvrClass *)core->sreg);
00461 
00462     /* Assuming that RAMPZ is always at 0x5b. If the device doesn't support
00463        RAMPZ, install a NULL pointer. */
00464 
00465     core->rampz = (RAMPZ *)avr_core_get_vdev_by_addr (core, 0x5b);
00466     if (core->rampz)
00467         class_ref ((AvrClass *)core->rampz);
00468 
00469     /* Attach the internal sram to the memory bus if needed. */
00470 
00471     if (sram_sz)
00472     {
00473         int base;
00474         VDevice *sram;
00475 
00476         if (dev_supp_has_ext_io_reg (dev))
00477             base = SRAM_EXTENDED_IO_BASE;
00478         else
00479             base = SRAM_BASE;
00480 
00481         core->sram = sram_new (base, sram_sz);
00482         sram = (VDevice *)core->sram;
00483 
00484         avr_message ("attach: Internal SRAM from 0x%04x to 0x%04x\n", base,
00485                      (base + sram_sz - 1));
00486 
00487         for (addr = base; addr < (base + sram_sz); addr++)
00488         {
00489             avr_core_attach_vdev (core, addr, "Internal SRAM", sram, 0, 0,
00490                                   0xff, 0xff);
00491         }
00492     }
00493     else
00494     {
00495         core->sram = NULL;
00496     }
00497 
00498     if (xram_sz)
00499     {
00500         int base;
00501         VDevice *xram;
00502 
00503         if (dev_supp_has_ext_io_reg (dev))
00504             base = SRAM_EXTENDED_IO_BASE + sram_sz;
00505         else
00506             base = SRAM_BASE + sram_sz;
00507 
00508         core->xram = sram_new (base, xram_sz);
00509         xram = (VDevice *)core->xram;
00510 
00511         avr_message ("attach: External SRAM from 0x%04x to 0x%04x\n", base,
00512                      (base + xram_sz - 1));
00513 
00514         for (addr = base; addr < (base + xram_sz); addr++)
00515         {
00516             avr_core_attach_vdev (core, addr, "External SRAM", xram, 0, 0,
00517                                   0xff, 0xff);
00518         }
00519     }
00520     else
00521     {
00522         core->xram = NULL;
00523     }
00524 
00525     core->eeprom = NULL;
00526 
00527     /* Initialize the decoder lookup table */
00528 
00529     decode_init_lookup_table ();
00530 }
00531 
00532 /**
00533  * \brief Destructor for the AvrCore class.
00534  * 
00535  * Not to be called directly, except by a derived class.
00536  * Called via class_unref.
00537  */
00538 void
00539 avr_core_destroy (void *core)
00540 {
00541     AvrCore *_core = (AvrCore *)core;
00542 
00543     if (_core == NULL)
00544         return;
00545 
00546     class_unref ((AvrClass *)_core->sreg);
00547     class_unref ((AvrClass *)_core->flash);
00548     class_unref ((AvrClass *)_core->gpwr);
00549     class_unref ((AvrClass *)_core->mem);
00550     class_unref ((AvrClass *)_core->stack);
00551 
00552     dlist_delete_all (_core->breakpoints);
00553     dlist_delete_all (_core->clk_cb);
00554     dlist_delete_all (_core->async_cb);
00555     dlist_delete_all (_core->irq_pending);
00556 
00557     class_destroy (core);
00558 }
00559 
00560 /** \brief Query the sizes of the 3 memory spaces: flash, sram, and eeprom. */
00561 void
00562 avr_core_get_sizes (AvrCore *core, int *flash, int *sram, int *sram_start,
00563                     int *eeprom)
00564 {
00565     *flash = flash_get_size (core->flash);
00566 
00567     if (core->sram)
00568     {
00569         *sram = sram_get_size (core->sram);
00570         *sram_start = sram_get_base (core->sram);
00571     }
00572     else
00573     {
00574         *sram = 0;
00575         *sram_start = 0;
00576     }
00577 
00578     if (core->eeprom)
00579         *eeprom = eeprom_get_size (core->eeprom);
00580     else
00581         *eeprom = 0;
00582 }

00584 /** \brief Attach a virtual device into the Memory. */
00585 extern inline void avr_core_attach_vdev (AvrCore *core, uint16_t addr,
00586                                          char *name, VDevice *vdev,
00587                                          int flags, uint8_t reset_value,
00588                                          uint8_t rd_mask, uint8_t wr_mask);
00589 
00590 /** \brief Returns the \c VDevice with the name \a name. */
00591 extern inline VDevice *avr_core_get_vdev_by_name (AvrCore *core, char *name);
00592 
00593 /** \brief Returns the \c VDevice which handles the address \a addr. */
00594 extern inline VDevice *avr_core_get_vdev_by_addr (AvrCore *core, int addr);
00595 
00596 /** \brief Sets the device's state (running, stopped, breakpoint, sleep). */
00597 extern inline void avr_core_set_state (AvrCore *core, StateType state);
00598 
00599 /** \brief Returns the device's state (running, stopped, breakpoint, sleep). */
00600 extern inline int avr_core_get_state (AvrCore *core);
00601 
00602 /** \brief Sets the device to a sleep state.
00603   * \param core Pointer to the core.
00604   * \param sleep_mode The BITNUMBER of the sleepstate.
00605   */
00606 extern inline void avr_core_set_sleep_mode (AvrCore *core, int sleep_mode);
00607 
00608 /** \brief Return the device's sleepmode. */
00609 extern inline int avr_core_get_sleep_mode (AvrCore *core);

00611 /*@}*/
00612 
00613 /** \name Program Memory Space Access Methods */
00614 
00615 /*@{*/
00616 
00617 /** \brief Reads a word from flash memory. */
00618 static uint16_t avr_core_flash_read (AvrCore *core, int addr);
00619 
00620 /** \brief Writes a word to flash memory. */
00621 static void avr_core_flash_write (AvrCore *core, int addr,
00622                                          uint16_t val);
00623 
00624 /** \brief Writes a byte to flash memory.
00625   *
00626   * This function writes the lower 8 bit of a flash word.
00627   * Use avr_core_flash_write() write to write a full word,
00628   * or avr_core_flash_write_hi8() to write the upper 8 bits.
00629   */
00630 static void avr_core_flash_write_lo8 (AvrCore *core, int addr,
00631                                              uint8_t val);
00632 
00633 /** \brief Writes a byte to flash memory.
00634   *
00635   * This function writes the upper 8 bit of a flash word.
00636   * Use avr_core_flash_write() write to write a full word,
00637   * or avr_core_flash_write_lo8() to write the lower 8 bits.
00638   */
00639 static void avr_core_flash_write_hi8 (AvrCore *core, int addr,
00640                                              uint8_t val);
00641 
00642 /*@}*/
00643 
00644 /** \name Data Memory Space Access Methods */
00645 
00646 /*@{*/
00647 
00648 /** \brief Reads a byte from memory.
00649   *
00650   * This accesses the \a register \a file and the \a SRAM.
00651   */
00652 static uint8_t avr_core_mem_read (AvrCore *core, int addr);
00653 
00654 /** \brief Writes a byte to memory.
00655   *
00656   * This accesses the \a register \a file and the \a SRAM.
00657   */
00658 static void avr_core_mem_write (AvrCore *core, int addr, uint8_t val);
00659 
00660 /*@}*/
00661 
00662 /** \name Status Register Access Methods */
00663 
00664 /*@{*/
00665 
00666 /** \brief Get the value of the status register. */
00667 
00668 static uint8_t avr_core_sreg_get (AvrCore *core);
00669 
00670 /** \brief Set the value of the status register. */
00671 
00672 static void avr_core_sreg_set (AvrCore *core, uint8_t v);
00673 
00674 /** \brief Get the value of bit \c b of the status register. */
00675 
00676 extern inline int avr_core_sreg_get_bit (AvrCore *core, int b);
00677 
00678 /** \brief Set the value of bit \c b of the status register. */
00679 
00680 extern inline void avr_core_sreg_set_bit (AvrCore *core, int b, int v);
00681 
00682 /*@}*/

00694 extern inline void avr_core_rampz_set (AvrCore *core, uint8_t v);

00712 /**
00713  * \name Direct I/O Register Access Methods
00714  *
00715  * IO Registers are mapped in memory directly after the 32 (0x20)
00716  * general registers.
00717  */
00718 
00719 /*@{*/
00720 
00721 /** \brief Displays all registers. */
00722 void
00723 avr_core_io_display_names (AvrCore *core)
00724 {
00725     int i;
00726     uint8_t val;
00727     char name[80];
00728 
00729     for (i = IO_REG_ADDR_BEGIN; i < IO_REG_ADDR_END; i++)
00730     {
00731         mem_io_fetch (core->mem, i, &val, name, sizeof (name) - 1);
00732         display_io_reg_name (i - IO_REG_ADDR_BEGIN, name);
00733     }
00734 }
00735 
00736 /** \brief Reads the value of a register.
00737   * \param core Pointer to the core.
00738   * \param reg The registers address. This address is counted above the
00739   *  beginning of the registers memory block (0x20).
00740   */
00741 extern inline uint8_t avr_core_io_read (AvrCore *core, int reg);
00742 
00743 /** \brief Writes the value of a register.
00744   * See avr_core_io_read() for a discussion of \a reg. */
00745 extern inline void avr_core_io_write (AvrCore *core, int reg, uint8_t val);
00746 
00747 /** \brief Read an io register into val and put the name of the register into
00748   * buf. */
00749 static void avr_core_io_fetch (AvrCore *core, int reg, uint8_t * val,
00750                                       char *buf, int bufsiz);
00751

00755 
00756 /*@{*/
00757 
00758 /** \brief Pop 1-4 bytes off of the stack.
00759  *
00760  * See stack_pop() for more details.
00761  */
00762 extern inline uint32_t avr_core_stack_pop (AvrCore *core, int bytes);
00763 
00764 /** \brief Push 1-4 bytes onto the stack.
00765  *
00766  * See stack_push() for more details.

00768 extern inline void avr_core_stack_push (AvrCore *core, int bytes,
00769                                         uint32_t val);

00773 /** \name Program Counter Methods */
00774 
00775 /*@{*/
00776 
00777 /** \brief Returns the size of the Program Counter in bytes.
00778  *
00779  * Most devices have a 16-bit PC (2 bytes), but some larger ones
00780  * (e.g. mega256), have a 22-bit PC (3 bytes).
00781  */
00782 extern inline int32_t avr_core_PC_size (AvrCore *core);
00783 
00784 /** \brief Returns the maximum value of the Program Counter.
00785  *
00786  * This is flash_size / 2.
00787  */
00788 static int32_t avr_core_PC_max (AvrCore *core);
00789 
00790 /** \brief Return the current of the Program Counter. */
00791 static int32_t avr_core_PC_get (AvrCore *core);
00792 
00793 /** \brief Set the Program Counter to val.
00794  *
00795  * If val is not in the valid range of PC values, it is adjusted to fall in
00796  * the valid range.
00797  */
00798 static void avr_core_PC_set (AvrCore *core, int32_t val);
00799 
00800 /** \brief Increment the Program Counter by val.
00801  *
00802  * val can be either positive or negative.
00803  *
00804  * If the result of the incrememt is outside the valid range for PC, it is
00805  * adjusted to fall in the valid range. This allows addresses to wrap around
00806  * the end of the insn space.
00807  */
00808 extern inline void avr_core_PC_incr (AvrCore *core, int val);
00809 
00810 /*@}*/
00811 
00812 /** \name Methods for accessing CK and instruction Clocks */
00813 
00814 /*@{*/
00815 
00816 /** \brief Get the current clock counter. */
00817 extern inline uint64_t avr_core_CK_get (AvrCore *core);
00818 
00819 /** \brief Increment the clock counter. */
00820 extern inline void avr_core_CK_incr (AvrCore *core);
00821 
00822 /** \brief Get the number of clock cycles remaining for the currently
00823  *  executing instruction. */
00824 extern inline int avr_core_inst_CKS_get (AvrCore *core);
00825 
00826 /** \brief Set the number of clock cycles for the instruction being
00827  *  executed. */
00828 extern inline void avr_core_inst_CKS_set (AvrCore *core, int val);
00829 
00830 /** \name Interrupt Access Methods. */
00831 
00832 /*@{*/
00833 
00834 /** \brief Gets the first pending irq. */
00835 IntVect *
00836 avr_core_irq_get_pending (AvrCore *core)
00837 {
00838     return irq_get_pending_vector (core->irq_pending, core->state,
00839                                    core->sleep_mode);
00840 }
00841 
00842 /** \brief Raises an irq by adding it's data to the irq_pending list. */
00843 void
00844 avr_core_irq_raise (AvrCore *core, unsigned int irq)
00845 {
00846     IntVect *irq_ptr = &core->irq_vtable[irq];
00847 
00848 #if !defined(DISABLE_IRQ_MESSAGES)
00849     avr_message ("Raising irq # %u [%s at 0x%x]\n", irq, irq_ptr->name,
00850                  irq_ptr->addr * 2);
00851 #endif
00852     core->irq_pending = irq_list_add (core->irq_pending, irq_ptr);
00853 }
00854 
00855 /** \brief Calls the interrupt's callback to clear the flag. */
00856 void
00857 avr_core_irq_clear (AvrCore *core, IntVect *irq)
00858 {
00859     core->irq_pending = irq_list_delete (core->irq_pending, irq);
00860 }
00861 
00862 /** \brief Removes all irqs from the irq_pending list. */
00863 extern inline void avr_core_irq_clear_all (AvrCore *core);
00864 
00865 /*@}*/
00866 
00867 /** \name Break point access methods. */
00868 
00869 /*@{*/
00870 
00871 /** \brief Inserts a break point. */
00872 
00873 void
00874 avr_core_insert_breakpoint (AvrCore *core, int pc)
00875 {
00876 #define BREAK_OPCODE 0x9598
00877 
00878     uint16_t insn = flash_read (core->flash, pc);
00879 
00880     core->breakpoints = brk_pt_list_add (core->breakpoints, pc, insn);
00881 
00882     flash_write (core->flash, pc, BREAK_OPCODE);
00883 }
00884 
00885 /** \brief Removes a break point. */
00886 
00887 void
00888 avr_core_remove_breakpoint (AvrCore *core, int pc)
00889 {
00890     BreakPt *bp;
00891 
00892     bp = brk_pt_list_lookup (core->breakpoints, pc);
00893     if (bp)
00894     {
00895         uint16_t insn = bp->opcode;
00896 
00897         core->breakpoints = brk_pt_list_delete (core->breakpoints, pc);
00898 
00899         flash_write (core->flash, pc, insn);
00900     }
00901 }
00902 
00903 #ifndef DOXYGEN                 /* don't expose to doxygen */
00904 
00905 struct bp_enable_data
00906 {
00907     AvrCore *core;
00908     int enable;
00909 };
00910 
00911 #endif /* DOXYGEN */
00912 
00913 static int
00914 iter_enable_breakpoint (AvrClass *data, void *user_data)
00915 {
00916     BreakPt *bp = (BreakPt *)data;
00917     struct bp_enable_data *bed = (struct bp_enable_data *)user_data;
00918 
00919     if (bed->enable)
00920     {
00921         uint16_t insn = flash_read (bed->core->flash, bp->pc);
00922 
00923         if (insn != BREAK_OPCODE)
00924         {
00925             /* Enable the breakpoint */
00926             bp->opcode = insn;
00927             flash_write (bed->core->flash, bp->pc, BREAK_OPCODE);
00928         }
00929     }
00930     else
00931     {
00932         /* Disable the breakpoint */
00933         flash_write (bed->core->flash, bp->pc, bp->opcode);
00934     }
00935 
00936     return 0;                   /* Don't delete any item from the list. */
00937 }
00938 
00939 /** \brief Disable breakpoints.
00940 
00941     Disables all breakpoints that where set using avr_core_insert_breakpoint().
00942     The breakpoints are not removed from the breakpoint list.  */
00943 
00944 void
00945 avr_core_disable_breakpoints (AvrCore *core)
00946 {
00947     struct bp_enable_data bed = { core, 0 };
00948 
00949     core->breakpoints =
00950         brk_pt_iterator (core->breakpoints, iter_enable_breakpoint, &bed);
00951 }
00952 
00953 /** \brief Enable breakpoints. 
00954 
00955     Enables all breakpoints that where previous disabled. */
00956 
00957 void
00958 avr_core_enable_breakpoints (AvrCore *core)
00959 {
00960     struct bp_enable_data bed = { core, 1 };
00961 
00962     core->breakpoints =
00963         brk_pt_iterator (core->breakpoints, iter_enable_breakpoint, &bed);
00964 }
00965 
00966 /*@}*/
00967 
00968 /* Private
00969   
00970    Execute an instruction.
00971    Presets the number of instruction clocks to zero so that break points and
00972    invalid opcodes don't add extraneous clock counts.
00973    
00974    Also checks for software breakpoints. 
00975    Any opcode except 0xffff can be a breakpoint.
00976    
00977    Returns BREAK_POINT, or >= 0. */
00978 
00979 static int
00980 exec_next_instruction (AvrCore *core)
00981 {
00982     int result, pc;
00983     uint16_t opcode;
00984     struct opcode_info *opi;
00985 
00986     pc = avr_core_PC_get (core);
00987     opcode = flash_read (core->flash, pc);
00988 
00989     /* Preset the number of instruction clocks to zero so that break points
00990        and invalid opcodes don't add extraneous clock counts. */
00991     avr_core_inst_CKS_set (core, 0);
00992 
00993     opi = decode_opcode (opcode);
00994 
00995     result = opi->func (core, opcode, opi->arg1, opi->arg2);
00996 
00997     if (global_debug_inst_output)
00998         fprintf (stderr, "0x%06x (0x%06x) : 0x%04x : %s\n", pc, pc * 2,
00999                  opcode, global_opcode_name[result]);
01000 
01001     return result;
01002 }
01003 
01004 /** \name Program control methods */
01005 
01006 /*@{*/
01007 
01008 /*
01009  * Private
01010  *
01011  * Checks to see if an interrupt is pending. If any are pending, and
01012  * if SREG(I) is set, the following will occur:
01013  *   - push current PC onto stack
01014  *   - PC <- interrupt vector
01015  *   - I flag of SREG is cleared
01016  *
01017  * Reset vector is not controlled by the SREG(I) flag, thus if reset
01018  * interrupt has occurred, the device will be reset irregardless of state
01019  * of SREG(I).
01020  *
01021  * \note There are different ways of doing this:
01022  * - In register.c  wdtcr_intr_cb() we can directly reset the MCU without
01023  *   the use of irqs. This would require to make the callback an async
01024  *   callback and it would allow the speed improvments commented out below
01025  *   to be activated.
01026  * - Keep it as an interrupt an waste CPU time.
01027  *
01028  * Ted, what do you think we should do?
01029  */
01030 
01031 static void
01032 avr_core_check_interrupts (AvrCore *core)
01033 {
01034     IntVect *irq;
01035 
01036     if (core->irq_pending)
01037     {
01038         irq = avr_core_irq_get_pending (core);
01039 
01040         if (irq)
01041         {
01042             if (irq->name == NULL)
01043             {
01044                 avr_error ("Raised an invalid irq for device");
01045             }
01046 
01047             if (irq->addr == IRQ_RESET_ADDR)
01048             {
01049                 /* The global interrupt (SREG.I) never blocks a reset. We
01050                    don't need to clear the irq since a reset clears all
01051                    pending irq's. */
01052                 avr_core_reset (core);
01053             }
01054 
01055             if (avr_core_sreg_get_bit (core, SREG_I))
01056             {
01057                 int pc = avr_core_PC_get (core);
01058                 int pc_bytes = avr_core_PC_size (core);
01059 
01060                 avr_core_stack_push (core, pc_bytes, pc);
01061                 avr_core_sreg_set_bit (core, SREG_I, 0);
01062 
01063 #if !defined(DISABLE_IRQ_MESSAGES)
01064                 avr_message ("Vectoring to irq at addr:0x%x offset:0x%x\n",
01065                              irq->addr * 2, core->irq_offset * 2);
01066 #endif
01067 
01068                 avr_core_PC_set (core, irq->addr + core->irq_offset);
01069 
01070                 avr_core_irq_clear (core, irq);
01071             }
01072         }
01073     }
01074 }
01075 
01076 /**
01077  * \brief Process a single program instruction, all side effects and
01078  * peripheral stimulii.
01079  *
01080  * Executes instructions, calls callbacks, and checks for interrupts.  */
01081 
01082 int
01083 avr_core_step (AvrCore *core)
01084 {
01085     int res = 0;
01086     int state;
01087 
01088     /* The MCU is stopped when in one of the many sleep modes */
01089     state = avr_core_get_state (core);
01090     if (state != STATE_SLEEP)
01091     {
01092         /* execute an instruction; may change state */
01093         res = exec_next_instruction (core);
01094     }
01095 
01096     /* Execute the clock callbacks */
01097     while (core->inst_CKS > 0)
01098     {
01099         /* propagate clocks here */
01100         avr_core_clk_cb_exec (core);
01101 
01102         avr_core_CK_incr (core);
01103 
01104         core->inst_CKS--;
01105     }
01106 
01107     /* FIXME: async cb's and interrupt checking might need to be put 
01108        somewhere else. */
01109 
01110     /* Execute the asynchronous callbacks */
01111     avr_core_async_cb_exec (core);
01112 
01113     /* Check interrupts here. If the previous instruction was a reti, then we
01114        need to delay handling of any pending IRQs until after the next
01115        instruction is executed. */
01116     if (res != opcode_RETI)
01117         avr_core_check_interrupts (core);
01118 
01119     return res;
01120 }
01121 
01122 /** \brief Start the processing of instructions by the simulator.
01123  *
01124  * The simulated device will run until one of the following occurs:
01125  *   - The state of the core is no longer STATE_RUNNING.
01126  *   - The simulator receives a SIGINT signal.
01127  *   - A breakpoint is reached (currently causes core to stop running).
01128  *   - A fatal internal error occurs.
01129  *
01130  * \note When running simulavr in gdb server mode, this function is not
01131  * used. The avr_core_step() function is called repeatedly in a loop when the
01132  * continue command is issued from gdb. As such, the functionality in this
01133  * loop should be kept to a minimum.
01134  *
01135  * \todo Should add some basic breakpoint handling here. Maybe allow
01136  * continuing, and simple breakpoint management (disable, delete, set)
01137  */
01138 
01139 void
01140 avr_core_run (AvrCore *core)
01141 {
01142     uint64_t cnt = 0;
01143     int res;
01144     uint64_t start_time, run_time;
01145 
01146     avr_core_reset (core);      /* make sure the device is in a sane state. */
01147 
01148     core->state = STATE_RUNNING;
01149 
01150     signal_watch_start (SIGINT);
01151 
01152     /* FIXME: [TRoth 2002/03/19] This loop isn't going to handle sleep or idle
01153        modes properly. */
01154 
01155     start_time = get_program_time ();
01156     while (core->state == STATE_RUNNING)
01157     {
01158         if (signal_has_occurred (SIGINT))
01159             break;
01160 
01161         res = avr_core_step (core);
01162 
01163         if (res == BREAK_POINT)
01164             break;
01165 
01166         cnt++;
01167     }
01168     run_time = get_program_time () - start_time;
01169 
01170     signal_watch_stop (SIGINT);
01171     
01172     /* avoid division by zero below */
01173     if (run_time == 0) run_time = 1;
01174     
01175     avr_message ("Run time was %lld.%03lld seconds.\n", run_time / 1000,
01176                  run_time % 1000);
01177 
01178     if (run_time == 0)
01179          run_time = 1;          /* Avoid division by zero. */
01180 
01181     avr_message ("Executed %lld instructions.\n", cnt);
01182     avr_message ("   %lld insns/sec\n", (cnt * 1000) / run_time);
01183     avr_message ("Executed %lld clock cycles.\n", avr_core_CK_get (core));
01184     avr_message ("   %lld clks/sec\n",
01185                  (avr_core_CK_get (core) * 1000) / run_time);
01186 }
01187 
01188 /** \brief Sets the simulated CPU back to its initial state.
01189  *
01190  *  Zeroes out PC, IRQ's, clock, and memory.
01191  */
01192 
01193 void
01194 avr_core_reset (AvrCore *core)
01195 {
01196     avr_core_PC_set (core, 0);
01197     avr_core_irq_clear_all (core);
01198 
01199     avr_core_inst_CKS_set (core, 0);
01200 
01201     /* Send clock cycles to display.
01202        Normaly the clockcycles must not be reset here!
01203        This leads to an error in the vcd file. */
01204 
01205     display_clock (core->CK);
01206 
01207     mem_reset (core->mem);
01208 }
01209 
01210 /*@}*/
01211 
01212 /** \name Callback Handling Methods */
01213 
01214 /*@{*/
01215 
01216 /**
01217  * \brief For adding external read and write callback functions.
01218  *
01219  * rd and wr should come in pairs, but it is safe to add
01220  * empty function via passing a NULL pointer for either function.
01221  *
01222  * \param core A pointer to an AvrCore object.
01223  *
01224  * \param port_id The ID for handling the simulavr inheritance model.
01225  *
01226  * \param ext_rd Function for the device core to call when it needs to
01227  * communicate with the external world via I/O Ports.
01228  *
01229  * \param ext_wr Function for the device core to call when it needs to
01230  * communicate with the external world via I/O Ports.
01231  *
01232  */
01233 void
01234 avr_core_add_ext_rd_wr (AvrCore *core, int addr, PortFP_ExtRd ext_rd,
01235                         PortFP_ExtWr ext_wr)
01236 {
01237     Port *p = (Port *)mem_get_vdevice_by_addr (core->mem, addr);
01238 
01239     if (p == NULL)
01240     {
01241         avr_warning ("Device does not have vdevice at 0x%04x.\n", addr);
01242         return;
01243     }
01244 
01245     port_add_ext_rd_wr (p, ext_rd, ext_wr);
01246 }
01247 
01248 /**
01249  * \brief Add a new clock callback to list.
01250  */
01251 extern inline void avr_core_clk_cb_add (AvrCore *core, CallBack *cb);
01252 
01253 /**
01254  * \brief Add a new asynchronous callback to list.
01255  */
01256 extern inline void avr_core_async_cb_add (AvrCore *core, CallBack *cb);
01257 
01258 /** \brief Run all the callbacks in the list.
01259  
01260     If a callback returns non-zero (true), then it is done with it's job and
01261     wishes to be removed from the list.
01262  
01263     The time argument has dual meaning. If the callback list is for the clock
01264     callbacks, time is the value of the CK clock counter. If the callback list
01265     is for the asynchronous callback, time is the number of milliseconds from
01266     some unknown, arbitrary time on the host system. */
01267 
01268 extern inline void avr_core_clk_cb_exec (AvrCore *core);
01269 
01270 /**
01271  * \brief Run all the asynchronous callbacks.
01272  */
01273 extern inline void avr_core_async_cb_exec (AvrCore *core);
01274 
01275 /*@}*/
01276 
01277 /**
01278  * \brief Dump the contents of the entire CPU core.
01279  *
01280  * \param core A pointer to an AvrCore object.
01281  * \param f_core An open file descriptor.
01282  */
01283 void
01284 avr_core_dump_core (AvrCore *core, FILE * f_core)
01285 {
01286     unsigned int pc = avr_core_PC_get (core);
01287 
01288     fprintf (f_core, "PC = 0x%06x (PC*2 = 0x%06x)\n\n", pc, pc * 2);
01289     mem_dump_core (core->mem, f_core);
01290     flash_dump_core (core->flash, f_core);
01291 }
01292 
01293 /**
01294  * \brief Load a program from an input file.
01295  */
01296 int
01297 avr_core_load_program (AvrCore *core, char *file, int format)
01298 {
01299     return flash_load_from_file (core->flash, file, format);
01300 }
01301 
01302 /** \brief Load a program from an input file. */
01303 int
01304 avr_core_load_eeprom (AvrCore *core, char *file, int format)
01305 {
01306     EEProm *ee = (EEProm *)mem_get_vdevice_by_name (core->mem, "EEProm");
01307 
01308     return eeprom_load_from_file (ee, file, format);
01309 }
